subject: Plumlogix - NEW BOARD MATCH
body:
The Plumlogix Advisory Board is seeking professionals with professional expertise like yours... view your invitation inside! - 
 
You're a Match!
 
Plumlogix
 Advisory Board
51 - 200 Employees | 
Currently seeking new board members 
Plumlogix
 is guiding CIOs to success with tailored Salesforce strategies and flawless execution. Their advisory board is currently seeking professionals across a range of expertise like sales, marketing, growth, strategy, healthcare, HR, IT, operations, product development, and more - 
your unique expertise is requested.
 
Join this advisory board
 
Explore 200+ Board Roles
 
The ROI of Joining Boards
✓
 Get involved in interesting new companies
✓
 Add board work to your resume & social profiles 
✓
 Elite networking and introductions
✓
 Elevate your current and future earning potential 
✓
 Long-term career stimulation and opportunities
 
Start exploring boards today
 
 
Boards Are Just the Beginning...
Getting set up on AdvisoryCloud is the easiest way to start joining boards, but that's just the beginning of your journey as an available advisor. 
Using your unique skills and expertise, we'll also help you create the incredible Advisor Profile where you'll be able to highlight your unique expertise, professional experience, and custom project-based advisory work you are available for - at whatever rates you want to charge.
As people find your profile, they can easily reach out to work with you. Companies managing their advisory boards on AdvisoryCloud will also come across your profile, and may choose to invite you to join their board or work with you 1-1.
It's never been this easy to get set up as a thought leader and advisor with your unique skill set. Give it a shot, no risk
 
- 
start your advisor profile today.
Explore 200+ advisory boards for free
Our team is ready to match you to boards in minutes, not months! Get started free on advisory cloud today and book a call with our team of executive agents to match you to boards based on your interests and expertise.
Get started free today
 
 
Copyright © 2024 AdvisoryCloud
Our address is 369-B Third Street, #301, San Rafael, Ca 94901, United States
 
To opt-out or manage your communication preferences, 
click here
.

subject: For you: Unlimited 5G mobile line INCLUDED for a year
body:
Plus, get up to $830 off premium 5G phones with Xfinity Mobile.
 
ADD XFINITY MOBILE ON US FOR A YEAR! 
Get an Unlimited 
5G mobile line 
INCLUDED
 for a year 
With your internet. Plus, choose from the latest device deals when you switch to Xfinity Mobile. 
Claim your line 
Offer ends 6/21. Xfinity Internet required. Reduced speeds after 30 GB of usage/line. 
Details & restrictions.
 
 
 
Want to shop the latest 
devices in person? 
Visit your local Xfinity Store 
Schedule an 
appointment 
Save up to $830
 on the latest 5G phones 
With qualifying trade-in and new Unlimited Plus line. 
Shop phones 
Ends 6/30. Requires 24-month device payment plan. Xfinity Internet required. Reduced speeds after 50 GB of usage/line. Data thresholds may vary. 
Details & restrictions.
 
 
 
Get 50% off
 a new tablet 
When you add a new tablet line. 
Shop tablets 
Ends 6/30. Limited to iPad (A16) 128GB. Requires new line activation within 30 days of purchase date. 
Details & restrictions.
 
 
 
 
 
Xfinity Rewards members can save up to 
$300 off smartwatches
 
Not enrolled? It's free to join and easy to enjoy. 
Get started 
Ends 4/14. Each smartwatch will be charged an additional $10 monthly smartwatch line fee. 
Details & restrictions
 
Shop deals
xfinity.com
Xfinity Stores
 
 
 
 
View online
 
|
Unsubscribe
|
Privacy Policy
THIS EMAIL IS AN ADVERTISEMENT
 
You are receiving this email because you’ve requested to receive emails with information about Comcast products and services.
If you do not wish to receive emails like this in the future, please 
click here
 to unsubscribe. 
Please do not reply to this email, it is not monitored. If you'd like to contact us, please visit our website 
here
. 
Restrictions apply. Not available in all areas. 
Xfinity Mobile requires residential post-pay Xfinity Internet. Line limitations may apply. Equip., intl. and roaming charges, taxes and fees, including reg. recovery fees, and other charges extra, and subj. to change. $25/mo. charge applies if Xfinity TV, Internet or Voice post-pay services not maintained. Pricing subject to change. During times of network congestion, your cellular data speeds may be slower temporarily. After monthly data use threshold for a line is exceeded, speeds are reduced until the billing cycle ends. A minimum $20.00 charge applies per month, per account for By the Gig lines, regardless of data usage. Charges apply to each GB or partial GB of shared data. No rollover data. For Xfinity Mobile Broadband Disclosures visit 
here
. 
Unlimited 5G mobile line included:
 Offer ends 6/21/25. Restrictions apply. Not available in all areas. New Xfinity Mobile customers only. Requires residential post-pay 300 Mbps internet or above. Offer limited to the value of one Unlimited line applied via 12 monthly bill credits. After 12 months, or if Internet service is canceled or downgraded, regular mobile rates apply. 
Up to $830 off eligible 5G phones:
 Offer ends 6/30/25. Requires qualifying phone trade-in, and purchase of any new eligible Apple, Samsung, Google or Motorola phone (includes iPhone 16 family , iPhone 15 family, iPhone 14 family, iPhone 13 , Galaxy S Series, Galaxy Z Series, Galaxy A35, Galaxy A36, Pixel 9 family, Pixel 8a, razr – 2024) while supplies last, a 24-month Xfinity Mobile Device Payment Plan Agreement (“Device Agreement”), and 1) activation of new Xfinity Mobile Unlimited Plus line within 30 days of phone purchase date or 2) phone upgrade on an existing Xfinity Mobile Unlimited Plus line and activation of phone on that line within 15 days of order. Existing phone must be paid in full. Trade-in must be completed within 21 days of phone shipment date. Must maintain line required for offer until trade-in is completed. Porting of number is not required with trade-in. Up to $830 via trade-in credit applied monthly to your account over Device Agreement period so long as Device Agreement is in effect. Actual trade-in amount varies depending on model of phones for trade in and purchase and will not exceed the retail value of purchased phone. If line is canceled, voluntarily or involuntarily, or phone payments are accelerated, balance of credits associated with Device Agreement are forfeited. Out of stock phones are not eligible. Offer not valid with prior purchases, returns or exchanges. May not be combined with other device offers. 
50% off eligible tablet:
 Offer ends 6/30/25. Limited to iPad (A16) 128GB. Requires activation of a new Xfinity Mobile data line within 30 days of tablet purchase date. Additional $20 monthly tablet line fee may apply. Must maintain the new line with an account in good standing for 90 days following line activation. Device credits applied monthly to your account over 24 months. If line is canceled, voluntarily or involuntarily, balance of credits associated with device payment are forfeited. Offer not valid with prior purchases, returns or exchanges. Back orders are eligible. Out of stock devices are not eligible. May not be combined with other device offers. 
Xfinity Rewards:
 To be eligible to enroll in the Xfinity Rewards Program you must be a current Xfinity post-pay TV or Internet, or Wireline Voice residential customer with a current and active Xfinity account in good-standing. Comcast employees who receive Xfinity courtesy services are not eligible to participate in the Program with respect to the address at which they receive Xfinity courtesy services. Visit 
https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/l3N9CxkA0ri17p0i1sZcy_HV4?domain=xfinity.com
 for more information. 
Up to $300 off eligible smartwatch:
 Offer ends 4/14/25. Limited to Xfinity members with Xfinity Mobile and account in good standing. $300 off for Diamond and Platinum tier Xfinity Rewards members, $150 off for Gold and Silver tier Xfinity Rewards members. Xfinity Mobile requires Xfinity Internet. Must first redeem reward on Xfinity Rewards dashboard, then enter offer code during checkout to receive advertised discount. Requires purchase and activation of new, eligible smartwatch device while supplies last, a 24 month Device Agreement, and activation of new Xfinity Mobile line within 30 days of device purchase date. When smartwatch is paired to compatible phone, data usage counts towards phone plan data allowance. Additional $10 monthly smartwatch fee applies. Pricing subject to change. Additional taxes and fees apply. Applicable taxes for the full smartwatch amount are charged when smartwatch is shipped (or when smartwatch is fulfilled in a Xfinity retail store) and are in addition to the monthly charge. Device credits applied monthly to your account over 24 months so long as Device Agreement is in effect. If line is canceled, voluntarily or involuntarily or device payments are accelerated, balance of credits associated with device payment are forfeited. One unique code per Xfinity Rewards member account/household. Code is valid for use in a maximum of five transactions. Not valid with prior purchases, returns or exchanges. Back orders are eligible. Out of stock devices are not eligible. Cannot be combined with other device offers.

All trademarks are the property of their respective owners. 
Comcast Cable, One Comcast Center
1701 JFK Boulevard, Philadelphia, PA 19103

subject: Re: DCP JV Baseball Parent/Guardian Emails (Corrected)
body:
Hello all,
Unfortunately, our game at Riverside-Brookfield today has been cancelled. Their field still hasn't recovered from the rain the other day. We are going to try to reschedule this game again. When I get word on that, I will let you all know. We are going to practice today from 3:00pm - 4:15pm at Horner Park before the Frosh/Soph game. I have already told the boys to meet at the field after school. 
Thanks,
Coach Hinkamp
On Thu, Apr 3, 2025 at 2:44 PM Zachary Hinkamp <
zhinkamp@depaulprep.org
> wrote:
Hello all,
I’m reaching out to let you know that we were able to reschedule yesterday’s cancellation! We will be playing tomorrow at 4:30pm AT Riverside-Brookfield High School. Since school is out at 2:11pm tomorrow, the bus will be leaving at 2:30pm from DCP. I will be letting the boys know after our game is finished today. 
Best,
Coach Hinkamp
Zachary Hinkamp (He/Him), LPC
Counselor
Head Sophomore Football Coach
Assistant JV Baseball Coach

On Wed, Apr 2, 2025 at 1:53 PM Zachary Hinkamp <
zhinkamp@depaulprep.org
> wrote:
Hello again,
Sorry to send another email today! But, I wanted to update you all about our plan for tomorrow. Tomorrow morning from 6:00am - 7:00am, we will practice before school at Bradley Fieldhouse. We are hoping that the field will be playable for tomorrow's game. If it is playable, the boys will go over to Horner Park after school. If it is not playable, we will not practice or meet after school since we're going to be practicing in the morning. I will send updates if things change.
Best,
Coach Hinkamp
On Wed, Apr 2, 2025 at 11:12 AM Zachary Hinkamp <
zhinkamp@depaulprep.org
> wrote:
Hello all,
I hope you're doing well! I'm reaching out to let you know that our game today against Riverside-Brookfield at Horner Park has been canceled due to weather. We will NOT be practicing today, so the boys have the day off! We are hoping to get this game rescheduled for this Friday (location to be determined). When this is finalized, I will circle back to let you all know. Tomorrow's game is also questionable based on the amount of rain we've gotten/will get throughout the day today, so I will let you and the boys know about that tomorrow when we know more. Thank you for your flexibility and understanding!
Best,
Coach Hinkamp
On Tue, Apr 1, 2025 at 1:25 PM Zachary Hinkamp <
zhinkamp@depaulprep.org
> wrote:
My apologies for the typo in my previous email. Wednesday's game against Riverside Brookfield is also at home (Hoerner Park) at 4:30pm.
On Tue, Apr 1, 2025 at 11:03 AM Zachary Hinkamp <
zhinkamp@depaulprep.org
> wrote:
Hello all,
I'm reaching out to let you know that there is a slight change for our game at Deerfield High School this afternoon at 4:30pm. We will now be playing on their Lower Level field, located behind their Varsity field. Their Varsity field is still underwater, but the Lower Level field is playable! The Frosh/Soph game against Deerfield has been moved to another location so we can play there. Also, the bus will be leaving from DCP at 3:00pm today. My apologies for not relaying this information earlier.
Looking ahead to the remaining games on our schedule this week:
Tomorrow's game at Riverside Brookfield isn't looking great, as the weather is supposed to get a bit rough with a lot of rain. I will communicate to you and the boys when I get information about this. 
For Thursday, we play at home against Amundsen, but based on the amount of rain we get tomorrow, Hoerner might be unplayable so I will let you all know about that when I hear. 
Friday the boys will have the day off of practice. 
Finally, Saturday we have a 10:00am game at Niles North. There will not be a bus to take us to this game, so we ask that you/the boys get themselves to the field (I will let them know when to get there when we get closer to that day). Niles North is a turf field, so even with the projected rain in the forecast, I'm hoping we can still get this game in! 
Again, I will make sure to communicate with you and the boys when I get word on these games.
Best,
Coach Hinkamp
Best,
Coach Hinkamp
On Sun, Mar 30, 2025 at 2:36 PM Zachary Hinkamp <
zhinkamp@depaulprep.org
> wrote:
Hello all,
I hope you’ve had a great weekend! I’m reaching out to share this week’s game/practice schedule. It is as follows:
-Monday 3/31: Game vs Glenbrook North 4:45pm at Hoerner Park
-Tuesday 4/1: Game at Deerfield High School 4:30pm
-Wednesday 4/2: Game vs Riverside Brookfield 4:30pm at Hoerner Park
-Thursday 4/3: Game vs Amundsen 4:30pm at Hoerner Park
-Friday 4/4: Off
-Saturday 4/5: Game at Niles North High School (turf) 10:00am
I will let the boys know about bus departure times this week. Looking forward to another great week!
GO RAMS!
Coach Hinkamp
Zachary Hinkamp (He/Him), LPC
Counselor
Head Sophomore Football Coach
Assistant JV Baseball Coach

> wrote:
Hello all,
I'm reaching out to give you the address for the game this Thursday at 5:00pm against U-High. We will be playing at IIT 
(
2967 S Michigan Ave, Chicago, IL 60616). The bus will be leaving DCP at 3:30pm. 
Best,
Coach Hinkamp
On Sun, Mar 23, 2025 at 12:47 PM Zachary Hinkamp <
zhinkamp@depaulprep.org
> wrote:
Hello all,
I hope you've all thawed out after yesterday's double header! Thank you to those that were able to come out and support us in the cold! I thought it was a great start to the season! 
This week is busy with games Monday-Thursday and then again on Saturday. This week's game/practice schedule is as follows:
-Monday 3/24: Game 6:30pm vs St. Pat's @ Reed-Dunning (Bus leaves DCP at 4:00pm)
-Tuesday 3/25: Game 4:30pm @ Whitney Young (Bus leaves DCP at 3:00pm)
-Wednesday 3/26: Game 4:30pm @ Niles West (Bus leaves DCP at 3:00pm)
-Thursday 3/27: Game 5:00pm @ U-High (Bus departure time TBD, will let boys know ASAP)
-Friday 3/28: Practice 3:00pm - 5:00pm @ Kerry Wood Field (might have to shift time and location)
-Saturday 3/29: Game 12:00pm @ Schaumburg (Bud departure time TBD, will let boys know ASAP)
I will follow up with another email when I hear back from Coach Colon regarding Thursday's bus departure, Friday's practice time and location, and Saturday's bus departure. 
GO RAMS!
Coach Hinkamp
On Thu, Mar 13, 2025 at 7:03 AM Zachary Hinkamp <
zhinkamp@depaulprep.org
> wrote:
Hello all,
It was very nice meeting many of you last night! As promised, here is the updated email chain (hoping I've got it correct this time!). As a reminder, I will share the practice schedule for the rest of the week, as well as the week of Spring Break:
Thursday 3/13: No Practice (hoping the boys go to the basketball game)
Friday 3/14: Practice 5:30pm - 7:00pm @ Clark Park
Saturday 3/15: Practice 8:00am - 10:00am @ Kerry Wood Field
SPRING BREAK
Monday 3/17: No Practice
Tuesday 3/18: No Practice
Wednesday 3/19: No Practice
Thursday 3/20: Practice (Time/Location TBD - will communicate when confirmed)
Friday 3/21: Practice (Time/Location TBD - will communicate when confirmed)
Saturday 3/22: Games 10:00am / 12:00pm (Double Header) vs Taft @ Laramie Park (Skokie)
I will be sending another email today or tomorrow (whenever I'm able to get this information confirmed) regarding the practice times and locations for Thursday and Friday of Spring Break. 
Again, thank you all for everything you've done/will do for the boys and team this year! 
GO RAMS!
Coach Hinkamp
-- 
Zachary Hinkamp (He/Him), LPC
Counselor
Head Sophomore Football Coach
Assistant JV Baseball Coach

subject: New items added to clearance!
body:
Your cart wants these.  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

subject: Our favorite insights from Women’s History Month at Chief
body:
Plus, building an enduring business by avoiding ‘growth at all costs.’
 
 
 
WOMEN’S HISTORY MONTH
 
‘Leave Things Stronger and Better Than You Find Them’
 
This March, we celebrated the power and promise of the executives in the Chief community through conversation and connection at our Clubhouses, The Chief Suite at SXSW, and beyond. Here are our favorite insights we heard on leading with impact and building a brighter future for women at the top.
 
Read More
 
 
 
INDUSTRY TRENDS & BUSINESS TACTICS
Why This CEO Avoided ‘Growth At All Costs’ To Build an Enduring Business
Karla Gallardo — Cuyana co-founder and 2025 New Era of Leadership Awards judge — explains how her less-is-more ethos has helped her succeed at the helm of the luxury goods brand.
 
READ MORE
 
 
 
Top Shelf
Supporting Women Executives Through Health Challenges Like Menopause
FORBES
How Costly Is a Resume Gap for Executives?
HARVARD BUSINESS REVIEW
Why Constant Interruptions Are Killing Your Strategic Thinking
FAST COMPANY
 
Bold Moves
Chiko Scozzafava
was hired as Chief Operating Officer at Ocean Conservancy 
Christine Yoder
was hired as Chief Operating Officer at CardioOne
 
Kendra King
was hired as Global Chief Design Officer at Spark Foundry
Tessa Pelkowski
was promoted to Chief People Officer at Neostella
 
Melissa Gordon
 
was hired as Senior Vice President, Global Marketing and Customer Engagement at Ascenda
Dawn Gillette
was hired as Head of Digital Lending at Grasshopper Bank
 
Jess Haehle 
was promoted to Head of Market Access & Trade Solutions at Viatris
Sasha Wallinger
 
was hired as Director of Marketing and Communications at the MIT Museum
 
Anna Litvak-Hinenzon
 
was hired as Adjunct Professor and SME Curriculum Advisor for Georgetown University’s Master's in Artificial Intelligence Management program
 
Anita Gupta
joined the board of Goldie Health, Inc.
 
Lucy Chen
received an honorable mention at the Alliance for Women in Media’s 50th Annual Gracie Awards
Mandeep Kaur
was named a 2025 Women's Peace & Humanitarian Fund Global Luminary
 
Anu Mandapati
was named one of Mogul AI’s Top 100 People Leaders of 2025
Michele O'Connor
was named to Morgan Stanley’s 2025 Chairman’s Club
 
Nazia Raoof
 
received a CIO 100 Award
Illyasha Peete
published 
Catalyze and Cultivate Consulting
 
 
 
 
Chief is the private network women executives rely on to raise their leadership game.

subject: Purchase your Cubs Charities 50/50 Raffle ticket entries today!
body:
Cubs fans across Illinois can purchase ticket entries for the Cubs Charities 50/50 Raffle online
 
 
Apr 4, 2025
 
View Online
 
 
On April 4, take advantage of the 
Cubs Charities 50/50 Raffle
 early-bird special: buy one, get one deal. From 10 a.m. to 1 p.m., you can purchase 600 chances for $100 or 4,000 chances for $200.
Cubs fans across Illinois can purchase ticket entries for the Cubs Charities 50/50 Raffle online and at Wrigley Field for the 2025 regular season! 
For all Cubs home games this season, fans can purchase raffle ticket entries online starting at 10 a.m. CDT until the end of that day's game or from a Raffle Ambassador at Wrigley Field when gates open until the bottom of the eighth inning.
 All purchases at Wrigley Field are cashless.
In accordance with state and local law, raffle ticket entries for the 
Cubs Charities 50/50 Raffle
 are only available for purchase in the State of Illinois. The winning ticket will receive half of the net proceeds from the game's raffle ticket sales and the other half will benefit Cubs Charities' mission to mobilize the power of sport to champion youth, families and communities.

body:

MUSEUM NEWS
 
 
Spider-Man Is Swinging by Griffin MSI Starting May 22 
Marvel’s Spider-Man: Beyond Amazing – the Exhibition
 is coming to Griffin MSI! Dive into more than 60 years of Spider-Man, from his comic book origins to his rise as a multimedia icon. Reserve your tickets today to secure the most popular entry times before they’re sold out!
  
Plan My Visit
Marvel's Spider-Man: Beyond Amazing – The Exhibition
 is presented by Bank of America.
  
 
JOIN OUR WEB
Save 10% on membership through April 7
Visit like a VIP with a Griffin MSI membership, now 10% off up to the Explorers Society level with promo code 
SPRINGBREAK
. You’ll receive free General Admission, discounted tickets to our temporary exhibitions (like 
Marvel’s Spider-Man: Beyond Amazing – the Exhibition
), exclusive member hours and more!
GET MY DISCOUNTED MEMBERSHIP
  
  
More From the Museum
 
  
 
  
IT'S TIME FOR ROBOT BLOCK PARTY
Continues tomorrow, April 5 from 
9:30 a.m. - 2 p.m.
Celebrate National Robotics Week at our annual 
Robot Block Party
, when our Rotunda is filled with the coolest ‘bots and mecha-stars presented by area robotics groups! This event is included in General Admission.
SEE EVENT DETAILS
  
 
  
FINAL DAYS OF 007 SCIENCE
Last day to see it is April 6
007 Science: Inventing the World of James Bond
 is in its last days at the Museum. Don’t miss your chance to see this blockbuster exhibition about the science and tech behind the world’s longest-running film franchise. Additional tickets required.

 or the Fandango app or

, and receive 125 Fandango FanRewardsPoints for each movie ticket. All or at least some portion of the purchase for each ticket must be paid using a credit or debit card, PayPal, credit in your Fandango account from a prior exchanged purchase or a Fandango gift card (i.e., if you use a promo code then only part of that purchase can be paid for using the promo code) to qualify for FanRewards Points. Movie tickets must be for a movie with a showtime starting before 11:59pm PT on the last day of the promotion period. When you receive 500 FanRewards Points, you will receive a $5.00 Discount Reward which you will need to convert into a Discount Promo Code for use on a qualifying purchase on 
http://www.fandango.com
 (which can be used on 
http://www.movietickets.com
) or 
http://www.FandangoAtHome.com
. Discount Promo Code expires 21 days after the $5.00 Discount Reward is posted to your Fandango account. Discount Promo Code cannot be combined with any other offer, promo code or discount. You may be required to pay taxes additionally. Discount Promo Codes cannot be used to purchase a gift card. After applying your Discount Promo Code, any unused balance will automatically expire. You must have a Fandango account to redeem your Discount Promo Code on Fandango. Fandango is free to join; you must be 18 years of age or older to use FanRewards Points. Void where prohibited. Fandango reserves the right to modify or cancel this offer at any time and without notice. This offer is subject to the FanRewards Program Terms at 
https://www.fandango.com/policies/fanrewards-terms
 and Fandango’s Terms and Policies and Privacy Policy at 
www.fandango.com/Terms-and-Policies
. 
††The "Get Two Movie Tickets Promotion" offer (the "Offer") is only valid for paid FanClub members, and is not available if you enroll in the free trial without also converting to a paid membership. To redeem your Offer promo code, enter the promo code at checkout during your next Fandango ticketing purchase. The offer promo code in this email is valid for two tickets for any movie, in any format, at any participating theater, for any time of day. The promo code is a one-time use promo code and it cannot be combined with any other offers. This promo code is valid for 30 days from when it is sent. This Offer is non-transferable and has no cash value. Adjustments to prior purchases will not be permitted. Fandango reserves the right to withdraw or modify this Offer at any time, in its sole discretion, and without notice. Additional terms and conditions apply. See 
Fandango FanClub Program Terms
 for details. 
*Overworld Explorer Pack is non-refundable. While supplies last. Movie ticket is non-refundable and non-exchangeable. You must be 18 years of age or older to purchase a bundle. The Collectible Creeper Concession Vessel will begin shipping in the month of April. Please use a physical U.S. address where the Collectible Creeper Concession Vessel shipment can be delivered. Once carrier confirms delivery, Fandango is not responsible for lost or stolen deliveries. See 
https://redeem.fandango.com/products/overworld-explorer-pack
 for full terms and conditions. 
**Limited time offer. Jetpack add-on requires Internet, a valid Microsoft account, and Minecraft: Bedrock Edition, Minecraft for PlayStation, or Minecraft for Nintendo Switch (each sold separately) (excludes Minecraft Java Edition). Log into your account on 
Fandango.com
 or the Fandango app between 12:00pm PT on 2/27/25 and 11:59pm PT on 4/6/25 and purchase at least one movie ticket to ‘A Minecraft Movie’ for an opening weekend showtime (4/3/25-4/6/25). Purchaser will receive a post purchase email containing 1 Minecraft Promotional Code (“Code”) that is good for 1 Jetpack add-on. Redeem Code at 
minecraft.net/redeem
 by 12/31/25. Then, launch Minecraft and sign in with the Microsoft account used to redeem your Code. Codes are one time use only. Limit: 1 Jetpack add-on per Microsoft account. You must have, and be logged into, your Fandango account to receive the promotional code. Fandango is free to join; you must be 18 years of age or older to create a Fandango account. Fandango reserves the right to modify or cancel this offer at any time and without notice. This offer is subject to Fandango's terms and policies, at 
www.fandango.com/Terms-and-Policies
. 
Microsoft is not a sponsor of this offer. Microsoft may, freely and without liability, remove Character Creator items redeemed through this promotion, suspend or ban accounts, and take other disciplinary or corrective action if Microsoft suspects or believes your account is engaged in fraudulent or abusive activity. Except as required by law, Codes cannot be redeemed or exchanged for cash and are not refundable. Geography limitations, country and balance restrictions, taxes, and Internet connection fees may apply. Microsoft Services Agreement (
aka.ms/MSA
) applies. Minecraft - ESRB Rating: E 10+. Visit

subject: Open House - Saturday 4/5 (10AM - 12PM) | 253 W Second St., OIB
body:
View in your browser
 
OPEN HOUSE
Saturday, April 5th from 10:00 AM to 12:00 PM
253 W Second Street, Ocean Isle Beach, NC
Hosted by Amy Mezzanotte | 704-242-0446
 
 
 
 
 
OPEN HOUSE – YOU’RE INVITED!
Please join us for an exclusive Open House at 253 W Second Street, Ocean Isle Beach, NC.
📅 Saturday, April 5th
⏰ 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM
💰 Offered at $1,375,000
Welcome to Coastal Luxury:
Experience the perfect blend of coastal elegance and modern luxury at 253 W Second Street, a stunning custom-built home just moments from the shore. Designed with meticulous attention to detail by the homeowners in collaboration with an interior designer and builder, this partially furnished 1,952-square-foot retreat is a true island paradise.
Exceptional Design & Thoughtful Layout:
This exquisite home boasts 4 bedrooms and 3 baths, offering ample space for relaxation and entertaining. The open and airy floor plan invites natural light, creating a warm and sophisticated ambiance. The main living area features LVP flooring for a perfect balance of durability and style, complemented by crown molding that extends throughout the home. Cozy up by the fireplace or immerse yourself in a premium entertainment experience with smart wiring, four built-in speakers, and pre-wiring for a surround sound system and center speaker (stereo equipment not included). A built-in TV antenna adds an extra layer of convenience.
Gourmet Kitchen & Elegant Primary Suite:
Designed for both function and style, the kitchen is equipped with sleek cabinetry, a modern electric stove, and generous space for culinary creativity. The primary suite offers a peaceful retreat with elegant crown molding, a spacious walk-in closet, and high-end finishes. Additional conveniences include a dedicated laundry area with a stackable washer and dryer, as well as a tankless water heater for endless comfort.
Breathtaking Ocean Views & Upper-Level Sanctuary:
The second floor is a true highlight, featuring a private balcony with stunning ocean views—the perfect setting for morning coffee or evening relaxation. This level also includes a cozy fireplace, a flexible den space, and a fourth bedroom with a spacious closet and private ensuite bathroom, making it ideal for guests or as a secondary retreat.
Don’t miss this opportunity to tour this exceptional home and experience its charm firsthand. We look forward to seeing you at the Open House!
For a private showing, contact Amy at 704-242-0446 to schedule your visit.
Open Home:
Sat Apr 5 2025 10:00am — 12:00pm

.
To view this email as a web page, click 
here.
Thursday - April 3, 2025
Today's 
Rundown
 is brought to you by WBEZ members and
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
by Bianca Cseke
 
 
 
 
 
 
Good afternoon! It’s Thursday, and I’m excited to check out the Art Institute’s first 
Frida Kahlo exhibit
. Here’s what you need to know today.
  
1.
A Venezuelan man arrested by ICE is set to be released temporarily to donate a kidney to his brother
 
Jose Gregorio Gonzalez is set to be temporarily released, according to members of the Resurrection Project, a local immigration advocacy group, which said ICE officials confirmed his likely release tomorrow. He has been held at Clay County Detention Center in Indiana since his arrest last month.
His brother, Jose Alfredo Pacheco Gonzalez, said at a news conference this week that he was diagnosed with end-stage kidney failure in late 2023, not long after arriving in Chicago from Venezuela. 
Doctors say he needs a life-saving kidney transplant, and his brother, who has lived in the U.S. since 2024, was set to be that donor before he was arrested by U.S. Immigration and Customs outside their Cicero home last month. He faces potential deportation to Venezuela.
“Relief in this case is not necessarily that Jose Gregorio gets to stay, it could very much mean that he still goes back,” Peter Meinecke, an attorney with the Resurrection Project who is representing Jose Gregorio Gonzalez, told the Sun-Times. “Delaying deportation would allow him to save his brother’s life.” [
Chicago Sun-Times/WBEZ
]
2.
The U.S. and Canada have long managed the Great Lakes together. That could be ending.
 
Political tensions, especially over tariffs, are threatening the future of the largest freshwater ecosystem on Earth, Juanpablo Ramirez-Franco and Izzy Ross report for WBEZ and Grist.
Since taking office, President Donald Trump and his administration have repeatedly stoked tensions with Canada, once considered one of the United States’ closest allies. Along with trade and tariffs, this strife has also raised questions about how the region’s water resources will be managed. 
Some Great Lakes advocates worry the diplomatic snub is a warning sign one of the world’s most successful examples of water-sharing could become collateral damage in a geopolitical rift.
“We are worried that maybe behind all this is the idea that a country one day will be able to take water out of the Great Lakes and manage water not as an ecosystem that needs to be preserved in its watershed but as a resource, as a commodity,” said Jérôme Marty, speaking as the director of the International Association for Great Lakes Research. [
WBEZ
]
SPONSOR MESSAGE FROM EXPO CHICAGO
EXPO CHICAGO returns April 24-27
EXPO CHICAGO returns April 24–27 to Navy Pier for its 12th edition. Featuring over 170 galleries from 93 cities and 36 countries, EXPO CHICAGO offers a week of dynamic programming you won’t want to miss! Secure your tickets now at 
expochicago.com.
3.
Resisting mayoral pressure, Choose Chicago picked tourism vet Kristen Reynolds as its CEO
 
Choose Chicago has named Kristen Reynolds to fill the key post, which has been the highest-paid public position in Chicago, my colleagues David Roeder and Fran Spielman write for the Chicago Sun-Times. Reynolds comes to Chicago after 27 years in tourism leadership, the last decade as CEO of New York’s Discover Long Island.
She will take over an organization that, with public and private funding, is tasked with promoting Chicago against cities that have much larger budgets to market themselves. While Chicago has seen growth in business and leisure travel, it still hasn’t hit record numbers it recorded just before the pandemic.
Reynolds’ hiring ends a more than yearlong search extended by tension between Choose Chicago’s high-powered board of business leaders and Mayor Brandon Johnson. The board wanted a tourism veteran with a proven track record, while sources said the mayor urged the hiring of an ally with no background in an insular industry. [
Chicago Sun-Times
]
4.
Two Jewish students attacked while supporting Israel on campus are suing DePaul
 
The lawsuit claims the university was negligent and failed to protect the students’ safety while on campus, Mary Norkol reports for the Chicago Sun-Times.
On Nov. 6, Max Long and Michael Kaminsky were outside DePaul’s student center when they were approached and attacked by two men wearing black face masks, according to Chicago police. The men beat them with their fists and either a soda can or water bottle, according to the complaint filed yesterday in Cook County Circuit Court.
A DePaul spokesperson said the university values the safety of its students and condemned antisemitism. The school is working with Chicago police on the investigation and said resources are available to students who were affected. [
Chicago Sun-Times
]
5.
The National Public Housing Museum opens this week in Chicago. Here’s a sneak peek.
 
About 20 years ago, when many of Chicago’s public housing units were being torn down after years of neglect, some former residents rallied to preserve one building among the Jane Addams Homes, one of the first Chicago Housing Authority projects, built in the 1930s.
That remaining building, at 919 S. Ada St., on Chicago’s Near West Side, is now the National Public Housing Museum, which opens tomorrow after years of fundraising and construction, Esther Yoon-Ji Kang reports for WBEZ.
While many Chicagoans are familiar with the disinvestment, decaying buildings and gang violence associated with public housing, the museum aims to paint a fuller picture of the history of buildings in the United States — one focused on the people who lived there. [
WBEZ
]
 
Here's what else is happening
 
The Dow dropped 1,400 points as U.S. stocks led a worldwide sell-off after Trump’s tariffs. [
AP
]
K-12 schools must say no to DEI to receive federal money, the Trump administration said. [
AP
]
The Pentagon’s acting inspector general announced an investigation into Pete Hegseth’s use of a Signal chat for Houthi attack plans. [
AP
]
Here’s a behind-the-scenes look at the Nintendo Switch 2, which hits the market in June. [
AP
]
 
Oh, and one more thing...
 
George Freeman was a Chicago legend and part of a family that constituted a bit of Chicago jazz royalty, Mitch Dudek writes for the Chicago Sun-Times. Freeman died Monday at age 97.
Freeman’s brothers were vaunted jazz saxophonist Von Freeman and drummer Eldridge “Bruz” Freeman. George Freeman was also the uncle of saxophonist Chico Freeman.
The April 11 and 12 shows George Freeman was slated to play at the Green Mill will go on as scheduled, but will now be a tribute by his three bandmates.
Jazz guitarists traditionally favor a polite, reserved tone, but Freeman’s sound was nastier and grungier, a raw and stinging attack that could bridge the gap between Chicago jazz and Chicago blues. [
Chicago Sun-Times
]
 
Tell me something good
 
What’s the best book you’ve read recently? I finally have some room on my library hold list, and I always feel like staying in for weeks after getting back from long trips.
Joyce writes:
“One of the best books I’ve recently read was 
The Women
 by Kristin Hannah. Being a teenager in the 1970’s the Vietnam War was always in the news, but it seemed to be all about the boys over there. When I read this book about the women that were there it made me stop and pause thinking what a shame it was that it took so long to bring this topic out in the open and give not only the men who served recognition but the women who deserved it as well.”
Susan writes:
“I really enjoyed reading 
Young Woman and the Sea
 by Glenn Stout — about the first woman to swim across the English Channel. The movie is really good too.
I’m also in the middle of 
All the Light You Cannot See
 by Anthony Doer. I’ve seen it recommended for awhile now, and now I can see why. It tells a story from a couple narrators during WWII. It’s so well written and hard to put down.”
And Marcos writes:
“The best book I've read recently was 
Somewhere Beyond the Sea
 by TJ Klune. It is the sequel to 
The House on the Cerulean Sea
. In a time of growing division in our country, I found in this book a beacon of hope, in the power of chosen family, and what it means to show up for one another as community. It paints the picture of the type of world I think we are capable of creating. Cannot recommend enough!”
Feel free to email me, and your response may be included in the newsletter this week.
Thanks for reading and have a nice night! I'll see you tomorrow.
— Bianca Cseke
The Rundown is reader-funded. 
Your gift of any amount helps power this newsletter and all of WBEZ’s reporting.

Hello all,
I’m reaching out to let you know that we were able to reschedule yesterday’s cancellation! We will be playing tomorrow at 4:30pm AT Riverside-Brookfield High School. Since school is out at 2:11pm tomorrow, the bus will be leaving at 2:30pm from DCP. I will be letting the boys know after our game is finished today. 
Best,
Coach Hinkamp

On Wed, Apr 2, 2025 at 1:53 PM Zachary Hinkamp <
zhinkamp@depaulprep.org
> wrote:
Hello again,
Sorry to send another email today! But, I wanted to update you all about our plan for tomorrow. Tomorrow morning from 6:00am - 7:00am, we will practice before school at Bradley Fieldhouse. We are hoping that the field will be playable for tomorrow's game. If it is playable, the boys will go over to Horner Park after school. If it is not playable, we will not practice or meet after school since we're going to be practicing in the morning. I will send updates if things change.
Best,
Coach Hinkamp
On Wed, Apr 2, 2025 at 11:12 AM Zachary Hinkamp <
zhinkamp@depaulprep.org
> wrote:
Hello all,
I hope you're doing well! I'm reaching out to let you know that our game today against Riverside-Brookfield at Horner Park has been canceled due to weather. We will NOT be practicing today, so the boys have the day off! We are hoping to get this game rescheduled for this Friday (location to be determined). When this is finalized, I will circle back to let you all know. Tomorrow's game is also questionable based on the amount of rain we've gotten/will get throughout the day today, so I will let you and the boys know about that tomorrow when we know more. Thank you for your flexibility and understanding!
Best,
Coach Hinkamp
On Tue, Apr 1, 2025 at 1:25 PM Zachary Hinkamp <
zhinkamp@depaulprep.org
> wrote:
My apologies for the typo in my previous email. Wednesday's game against Riverside Brookfield is also at home (Hoerner Park) at 4:30pm.
On Tue, Apr 1, 2025 at 11:03 AM Zachary Hinkamp <
zhinkamp@depaulprep.org
> wrote:
Hello all,
I'm reaching out to let you know that there is a slight change for our game at Deerfield High School this afternoon at 4:30pm. We will now be playing on their Lower Level field, located behind their Varsity field. Their Varsity field is still underwater, but the Lower Level field is playable! The Frosh/Soph game against Deerfield has been moved to another location so we can play there. Also, the bus will be leaving from DCP at 3:00pm today. My apologies for not relaying this information earlier.
Looking ahead to the remaining games on our schedule this week:
Tomorrow's game at Riverside Brookfield isn't looking great, as the weather is supposed to get a bit rough with a lot of rain. I will communicate to you and the boys when I get information about this. 
For Thursday, we play at home against Amundsen, but based on the amount of rain we get tomorrow, Hoerner might be unplayable so I will let you all know about that when I hear. 
Friday the boys will have the day off of practice. 
Finally, Saturday we have a 10:00am game at Niles North. There will not be a bus to take us to this game, so we ask that you/the boys get themselves to the field (I will let them know when to get there when we get closer to that day). Niles North is a turf field, so even with the projected rain in the forecast, I'm hoping we can still get this game in! 
Again, I will make sure to communicate with you and the boys when I get word on these games.
Best,
Coach Hinkamp
Best,
Coach Hinkamp
On Sun, Mar 30, 2025 at 2:36 PM Zachary Hinkamp <
zhinkamp@depaulprep.org
> wrote:
Hello all,
I hope you’ve had a great weekend! I’m reaching out to share this week’s game/practice schedule. It is as follows:
-Monday 3/31: Game vs Glenbrook North 4:45pm at Hoerner Park
-Tuesday 4/1: Game at Deerfield High School 4:30pm
-Wednesday 4/2: Game vs Riverside Brookfield 4:30pm at Hoerner Park
-Thursday 4/3: Game vs Amundsen 4:30pm at Hoerner Park
-Friday 4/4: Off
-Saturday 4/5: Game at Niles North High School (turf) 10:00am
I will let the boys know about bus departure times this week. Looking forward to another great week!
GO RAMS!
Coach Hinkamp

On Sun, Mar 23, 2025 at 12:47 PM Zachary Hinkamp <
zhinkamp@depaulprep.org
> wrote:
Hello all,
I hope you've all thawed out after yesterday's double header! Thank you to those that were able to come out and support us in the cold! I thought it was a great start to the season! 
This week is busy with games Monday-Thursday and then again on Saturday. This week's game/practice schedule is as follows:
-Monday 3/24: Game 6:30pm vs St. Pat's @ Reed-Dunning (Bus leaves DCP at 4:00pm)
-Tuesday 3/25: Game 4:30pm @ Whitney Young (Bus leaves DCP at 3:00pm)
-Wednesday 3/26: Game 4:30pm @ Niles West (Bus leaves DCP at 3:00pm)
-Thursday 3/27: Game 5:00pm @ U-High (Bus departure time TBD, will let boys know ASAP)
-Friday 3/28: Practice 3:00pm - 5:00pm @ Kerry Wood Field (might have to shift time and location)
-Saturday 3/29: Game 12:00pm @ Schaumburg (Bud departure time TBD, will let boys know ASAP)
I will follow up with another email when I hear back from Coach Colon regarding Thursday's bus departure, Friday's practice time and location, and Saturday's bus departure. 
GO RAMS!
Coach Hinkamp
On Thu, Mar 13, 2025 at 7:03 AM Zachary Hinkamp <
zhinkamp@depaulprep.org
> wrote:
Hello all,
It was very nice meeting many of you last night! As promised, here is the updated email chain (hoping I've got it correct this time!). As a reminder, I will share the practice schedule for the rest of the week, as well as the week of Spring Break:
Thursday 3/13: No Practice (hoping the boys go to the basketball game)
Friday 3/14: Practice 5:30pm - 7:00pm @ Clark Park
Saturday 3/15: Practice 8:00am - 10:00am @ Kerry Wood Field
SPRING BREAK
Monday 3/17: No Practice
Tuesday 3/18: No Practice
Wednesday 3/19: No Practice
Thursday 3/20: Practice (Time/Location TBD - will communicate when confirmed)
Friday 3/21: Practice (Time/Location TBD - will communicate when confirmed)
Saturday 3/22: Games 10:00am / 12:00pm (Double Header) vs Taft @ Laramie Park (Skokie)
I will be sending another email today or tomorrow (whenever I'm able to get this information confirmed) regarding the practice times and locations for Thursday and Friday of Spring Break. 
Again, thank you all for everything you've done/will do for the boys and team this year! 
GO RAMS!
Coach Hinkamp

subject: 8(a) + GSA Schedule: Unlocking Sales Growth
body:
8(a) + GSA Schedule: Unlocking Sales Growth                                                         
8(a) + GSA Schedule: Unlocking Sales Growth
 
8(a) + GSA Schedule: Unlocking Sales Growth
Learn More
 
Many may not realize that while there are approximately 5,800 8(a) firms sharing around $27 billion in annual sales—averaging about $4.7 million per firm—there exists a distinct subset of 1,400 8(a) firms that command a significant portion of the market. The reality is that of the total 8(a) firms, 4,400 average $2.4 million annually in federal sales, while the top 1,400 average an impressive $11.8 million each year.
So, what sets these 1,400 firms apart from the other 75%? The answer lies in their strategic decision to obtain a GSA Schedule Contract. A GSA Schedule is a government-wide, "evergreen" contract that does not expire or have a spending cap, allowing firms to place their products and services in an approved price catalog accessible to all federal buyers.
On average, GSA Schedule holders generate $1.6 million per year in sales from their contracts—an impressive figure, yet it does not fully explain the substantial gap between the $11.8 million and the $2.4 million averages. 
Here’s why having a GSA Schedule is pivotal:
1. Visibility for Federal Buyers: 
Federal buyers utilize GSA Schedules for market research. Without a GSA Schedule, your firm risks being overlooked. While some may view sam.gov as a competitor for finding 8(a) firms, consider the difference: a concise paragraph in a capabilities statement versus access to an entire price catalog.
2. Increased Trust:
 GSA Schedules provide an added layer of assurance to federal buyers, fostering confidence in the products and services they are procuring.
3. Access to Opportunities:
 GSA Schedule holders can engage with GSA eBuy, an online platform where firms can access smaller projects, allowing them to establish a foothold with federal agencies.
4. Gateway to Further Opportunities:
 Securing a GSA Schedule often serves as a stepping stone for firms to pursue additional government-wide contracting vehicles.
For those looking to obtain 8(a) Certification and maximize the benefits of their nine years of eligibility, we highly recommend that you pursue a GSA Schedule concurrently with your 8(a) Certification. This strategic alignment could significantly enhance your firm's success in the federal marketplace. If federal contracting is an integral part of your marketing plan, don’t hesitate to reach out to us. We are here to assist you with your eligibility and guide you through the process to ensure you capitalize on these valuable opportunities. Call us today to discuss how we can support your journey to success.
Emily Hatchel
859-360-0909
www.advancegsa.com
Advance GSA
10500 Norbotten Dr
Florence Kentucky 41042
United States

subject: A drop in violent crime in Chicago
body:
Plus, the 2025 James Beard Award finalists. Here’s what you need to know today.
 
.
To view this email as a web page, click 
here.
Wednesday - April 2, 2025
Today's 
Rundown
 is brought to you by WBEZ members and
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
by Bianca Cseke
 
 
 
 
 
 
Good afternoon! It’s Wednesday, and today I learned there’s a new “sunshine” 
sparkling water flavor
. (As a sparkling water sommelier, I’m really hoping it doesn’t literally taste like sunflowers.) Here’s what else you need to know today. 
  
1.
Chicago’s murder drop ‘mirrors a lot of big cities,’ a leading crime data analyst says
 
The year’s first three months had fewer murders than any quarter since early 2019, and the city’s annual murder count has been dropping since 2021, my WBEZ colleague Chip Mitchell reports.
Chicago finished the year’s first quarter this week with 96 murders, a drop of more than 15% from the first three months of last year.
Data analyst Jeff Asher, who closely follows crime numbers in Chicago and other U.S. cities, told WBEZ these numbers mirror national trends, including in Baltimore, Philadelphia and New Orleans.
Beyond murders, other violent crimes like batteries and robberies are also down, despite public perceptions that crime is increasing.
“I think the biggest factor is that we generally don’t have a lot of really good crime data,” Asher said. “Only recently have we been in a position to measure hundreds of cities and build a national sample to tell what the trends are. So, it leads to people basically relying on anecdotes: ‘Have I seen more robberies in the news than I saw last year?’ And you’re always going to have a recency bias: ‘How can crime possibly be down if, three weeks ago, my cousin’s barber was robbed?’ ” [
WBEZ
]
2.
Illinois home insurance prices jumped 50% in three years — the second-highest in the country, a study shows
 
A typical homeowner in Illinois is paying almost $1,000 more per year for home insurance in 2024 compared with three years earlier, an increase that also impacts potential homebuyers, Stephanie Zimmermann and David Struett report for the Chicago Sun-Times.
The average cost last year for $350,000 worth of replacement coverage from one of the six major insurers in Illinois was $2,942, up from $1,968 in 2021, according to a nationwide analysis of insurance rate data by the Consumer Federation of America.
States like Florida and Louisiana saw higher prices for home insurance, but the rate of increase in Illinois raises concerns about affordability in a state that’s far away from hurricanes and wildfires, the study’s authors said.
Bridgeport resident Ellen Grimes said she has tried finding a more affordable homeowners insurance policy for her two-flat but kept getting rejected by companies that didn’t want to insure her 1880s-era home. Her annual premium this year is $3,246. In 2020, it was $2,423. [
Chicago Sun-Times
]
SPONSOR MESSAGE FROM MEEZ MEALS
Your Personal Sous Chef Has Arrived
A completely new approach to scratch-cooking.
  Ingredients arrive chopped and prepped (no dicing onions/peeling carrots). From unboxing to sizzling skillet to dinner table in 30 minutes!
Local Meez Meals has 
no subscriptions
 and offers over 
two dozen customizations
 including no dairy, gluten-free, no onions…
Visit 
meezmeals.com
, use code 
RADIO
 for 50% off first order!
3.
Mayor Brandon Johnson urges ticket scofflaws to take advantage of the city’s three-month amnesty program
 
The mayor is offering Chicagoans an opportunity to dig their way out of the financial hole created by unpaid parking tickets and other outstanding vehicular violations, my colleague Fran Spielman writes for the Chicago Sun-Times.
If a resident’s eligible vehicle ticket debt was placed in what’s known as final determination status before Dec. 31, 2023, that outstanding debt can now be settled by paying only the base fine by June 30.
“This program also includes relief on towing, storage and booting fees. Plus, those late payment penalties and collection costs are waived. Even if you are currently on a payment plan for ticket debt, you qualify for this relief program,” Johnson said. “To Chicagoans who have old ticket debt, this is your chance for a fresh start. So do not wait. Go to 
Chicago.gov/vdr
… to find out more and pay your tickets.” [
Chicago Sun-Times
]
4.
Venezuelans in Chicago are relieved their deportation protection is safe, for now
 
Many celebrated the news that a federal judge had paused the Trump administration’s plan to end temporary protected status for Venezuelans this month, my colleague Adriana Cardona-Maguigad reports.
Temporary Protected Status, or TPS, allows non-U.S. citizens from 17 countries, including Venezuela, to live and work in the United States if they face extremely difficult or unsafe conditions in their home country. The Trump administration announced an end to the program for Venezuelans in February.
Luciano Pedota, co-founder of the Illinois Venezuelan Alliance, told WBEZ the court’s ruling is important because the government couldn’t prove extending TPS for Venezuelans poses a danger to the United States or that it’s safe for them to return to Venezuela. [
WBEZ
]
5.
Chicago restaurants Galit, Maxwells Trading, Kumiko are among the 2025 James Beard Award finalists
 
Five Chicago restaurants are finalists for this year’s James Beard Awards.
Lincoln Park’s ode to Middle Eastern cuisine Galit is a finalist for Outstanding Restaurant, while Maxwells Trading, HaiSous and Oriole are all among this year’s finalists in the Best Chef Great Lakes category, the James Beard Foundation announced today. The list was culled from 22 Chicago semifinalists announced in January.
Kumiko in the West Loop is nominated for Outstanding Bar. You can see the full list of finalists in the link.
This year marks the 35th anniversary of the coveted awards, which are named for the late James Beard, a pioneering American chef. Often dubbed “the Oscars of the culinary world,” the prize has become the nation’s top food honor. [
WBEZ
]
 
Here's what else is happening
 
A federal judge dropped the corruption case against New York City Mayor Eric Adams. [
NPR
]
Despite Elon Musk’s millions, Democratic-backed Susan Crawford won a Wisconsin Supreme Court seat. [
AP
]
Top Gun
 star Val Kilmer died at 65. [
AP
]
The Illinois Secretary of State opened a new flagship center downtown. [
Chicago Sun-Times
]
 
Oh, and one more thing...
 
In 1995, Tara Mallen co-founded Rivendell Theatre Ensemble with a mission to elevate the lives of women through theater. 
The company is now celebrating its 30th anniversary season with the world premiere of 
No Such Thing
, a new work by Chicago playwright Lisa Dillman. It’s about a creative woman in her 60s who reclaims her power by having a spicy affair with a younger man, WBEZ theater reporter Mike Davis writes.
“We just learned that women’s rights are not really very important, and that women’s autonomy is being taken away from us on a daily basis across this country right now,” said Mallen, who is Rivendell’s artistic director. “We live in a country where guns have more rights than women.” [
WBEZ
]
 
Tell me something good
 
What’s the best book you’ve read recently? I finally have some room on my library hold list, and I always feel like staying in for weeks after getting back from long trips.
Jacqueline writes:
“The best book I've read more recently would probably be 
The Book Censor's Library
 by Bothayna Al-Essa which was an absolutely fantastic and scarily relevant book. But the best book I’ve read this year is definitely 
East of Eden
 by John Steinbeck which I wish I had read sooner because it is one of the best books I have ever read. Anyone who wants a good story with gorgeous prose should read this epic familial battle of good and evil. It’s a classic for a reason.”
Kalpana writes:
“
Thursday Murder Club
 by Richard Osman. A [group] of octogenarians solving murders at a retirement home in the UK. Can’t wait to read the sequel and the movie when it comes out.”
And Ann writes:
“
James
 by Percival Everett is the retelling of the Huck Finn story from the point of view of Jim, the enslaved man. Wow, what a book. Marvelously written, holds your interest from start to finish, and gives you a visceral feeling of what it would be like to be a runaway slave.”
Feel free to email me, and your response may be included in the newsletter this week.
Thanks for reading and have a nice night! I'll see you tomorrow.
— Bianca Cseke
The Rundown is reader-funded. 
Your gift of any amount helps power this newsletter and all of WBEZ’s reporting. 
DONATE TODAY
©Chicago Public Media Inc 848 East Grand Ave, Navy Pier Chicago, IL 60611
Unsubscribe from The Daily Rundown
 |

subject: Re: DCP JV Baseball Parent/Guardian Emails (Corrected)
body:
Hello again,
Sorry to send another email today! But, I wanted to update you all about our plan for tomorrow. Tomorrow morning from 6:00am - 7:00am, we will practice before school at Bradley Fieldhouse. We are hoping that the field will be playable for tomorrow's game. If it is playable, the boys will go over to Horner Park after school. If it is not playable, we will not practice or meet after school since we're going to be practicing in the morning. I will send updates if things change.
Best,
Coach Hinkamp
On Wed, Apr 2, 2025 at 11:12 AM Zachary Hinkamp <
zhinkamp@depaulprep.org
> wrote:
Hello all,
I hope you're doing well! I'm reaching out to let you know that our game today against Riverside-Brookfield at Horner Park has been canceled due to weather. We will NOT be practicing today, so the boys have the day off! We are hoping to get this game rescheduled for this Friday (location to be determined). When this is finalized, I will circle back to let you all know. Tomorrow's game is also questionable based on the amount of rain we've gotten/will get throughout the day today, so I will let you and the boys know about that tomorrow when we know more. Thank you for your flexibility and understanding!
Best,
Coach Hinkamp
On Tue, Apr 1, 2025 at 1:25 PM Zachary Hinkamp <
zhinkamp@depaulprep.org
> wrote:
My apologies for the typo in my previous email. Wednesday's game against Riverside Brookfield is also at home (Hoerner Park) at 4:30pm.
On Tue, Apr 1, 2025 at 11:03 AM Zachary Hinkamp <
zhinkamp@depaulprep.org
> wrote:
Hello all,
I'm reaching out to let you know that there is a slight change for our game at Deerfield High School this afternoon at 4:30pm. We will now be playing on their Lower Level field, located behind their Varsity field. Their Varsity field is still underwater, but the Lower Level field is playable! The Frosh/Soph game against Deerfield has been moved to another location so we can play there. Also, the bus will be leaving from DCP at 3:00pm today. My apologies for not relaying this information earlier.
Looking ahead to the remaining games on our schedule this week:
Tomorrow's game at Riverside Brookfield isn't looking great, as the weather is supposed to get a bit rough with a lot of rain. I will communicate to you and the boys when I get information about this. 
For Thursday, we play at home against Amundsen, but based on the amount of rain we get tomorrow, Hoerner might be unplayable so I will let you all know about that when I hear. 
Friday the boys will have the day off of practice. 
Finally, Saturday we have a 10:00am game at Niles North. There will not be a bus to take us to this game, so we ask that you/the boys get themselves to the field (I will let them know when to get there when we get closer to that day). Niles North is a turf field, so even with the projected rain in the forecast, I'm hoping we can still get this game in! 
Again, I will make sure to communicate with you and the boys when I get word on these games.
Best,
Coach Hinkamp
Best,
Coach Hinkamp
On Sun, Mar 30, 2025 at 2:36 PM Zachary Hinkamp <
zhinkamp@depaulprep.org
> wrote:
Hello all,
I hope you’ve had a great weekend! I’m reaching out to share this week’s game/practice schedule. It is as follows:
-Monday 3/31: Game vs Glenbrook North 4:45pm at Hoerner Park
-Tuesday 4/1: Game at Deerfield High School 4:30pm
-Wednesday 4/2: Game vs Riverside Brookfield 4:30pm at Hoerner Park
-Thursday 4/3: Game vs Amundsen 4:30pm at Hoerner Park
-Friday 4/4: Off
-Saturday 4/5: Game at Niles North High School (turf) 10:00am
I will let the boys know about bus departure times this week. Looking forward to another great week!
GO RAMS!
Coach Hinkamp

zhinkamp@depaulprep.org
> wrote:
Hello all,
I hope you've all thawed out after yesterday's double header! Thank you to those that were able to come out and support us in the cold! I thought it was a great start to the season! 
This week is busy with games Monday-Thursday and then again on Saturday. This week's game/practice schedule is as follows:
-Monday 3/24: Game 6:30pm vs St. Pat's @ Reed-Dunning (Bus leaves DCP at 4:00pm)
-Tuesday 3/25: Game 4:30pm @ Whitney Young (Bus leaves DCP at 3:00pm)
-Wednesday 3/26: Game 4:30pm @ Niles West (Bus leaves DCP at 3:00pm)
-Thursday 3/27: Game 5:00pm @ U-High (Bus departure time TBD, will let boys know ASAP)
-Friday 3/28: Practice 3:00pm - 5:00pm @ Kerry Wood Field (might have to shift time and location)
-Saturday 3/29: Game 12:00pm @ Schaumburg (Bud departure time TBD, will let boys know ASAP)
I will follow up with another email when I hear back from Coach Colon regarding Thursday's bus departure, Friday's practice time and location, and Saturday's bus departure. 
GO RAMS!
Coach Hinkamp
On Thu, Mar 13, 2025 at 7:03 AM Zachary Hinkamp <
zhinkamp@depaulprep.org
> wrote:
Hello all,
It was very nice meeting many of you last night! As promised, here is the updated email chain (hoping I've got it correct this time!). As a reminder, I will share the practice schedule for the rest of the week, as well as the week of Spring Break:
Thursday 3/13: No Practice (hoping the boys go to the basketball game)
Friday 3/14: Practice 5:30pm - 7:00pm @ Clark Park
Saturday 3/15: Practice 8:00am - 10:00am @ Kerry Wood Field
SPRING BREAK
Monday 3/17: No Practice
Tuesday 3/18: No Practice
Wednesday 3/19: No Practice
Thursday 3/20: Practice (Time/Location TBD - will communicate when confirmed)
Friday 3/21: Practice (Time/Location TBD - will communicate when confirmed)
Saturday 3/22: Games 10:00am / 12:00pm (Double Header) vs Taft @ Laramie Park (Skokie)
I will be sending another email today or tomorrow (whenever I'm able to get this information confirmed) regarding the practice times and locations for Thursday and Friday of Spring Break. 
Again, thank you all for everything you've done/will do for the boys and team this year! 
GO RAMS!
Coach Hinkamp

subject: VIP Access Summer Festival of Soccer 2026
body:
Hi 
Monica, 
Set to be hosted in 2026, with 48 Teams in attendance, the 
Summer Festival of Soccer
 is a bucket list event spanning 16 cities across the 
United States, 
Mexico
 and Canada. 
 
Returning to the United States for the first time since 1994, this is 
a great opportunity
 to treat you 
key clients to an unforgettable experience
 at the most 
anticipated
 event of the decade.
 
Visit our website for more information: 
2026 Summer Festival of Soccer
 
With 
VIP access
, including exclusive on-site hospitality, live-entertainment and chauffeur transfers, our bespoke packages are designed on the requirements of your group, with the ability to 
choose a specific match 
to attend at a city / venue of your choice.
 
Whether 
it’s
 a group-game, a knock-out stage match or the Final, please let me know your desired venue or simply 
book a 10-minute call
 so we can go over your 
group’s requirements
 and our 
exclusive packages.
 
Andrew Kokotov
Associate Director - North America
M: +1 514 726 6415 | T: +1 514 289 9700 ext: 134
About 
Curation
 by marcusevans. 
Marcus Evans provides high level industry specific summits, conferences, training and online events delivering over 500 events per year. You are receiving this email as your professional profile matches the focus and content of the event or its target audience. Should you feel this content is not relevant then please click here to 
adjust your preferences
 on what we send you and how often, or to unsubscribe completely from future emails. For more information on our data privacy policy 
click here

subject: Ends soon: Early bird '25-'26 ski sale + Welcome aboard, Nashville!
body:
Flight offer available through midnight, April 7
 
Your Saga Club number
4995112496
Saga Points balance
0
Tier status
Saga Blue
Ends Monday |
 Early bird ski sale
Travel valid November 23, 2025 - March 11, 2026
Now's the time to save on flights to Europe's top regions for the the next ski season! 
Fares to Barcelona, Helsinki, Munich, Oslo, Stockholm and Zurich are on sale now through midnight, April 7 starting at $394 roundtrip.
Two ski trips in one?
 Just add a Stopover in Iceland at the time of booking for up to 7 nights at no additional airfare!
 
Hit the slopes
 
Howdy Nashville: Iceland is now on sale!
Seasonal, non-stop service begins April 10!
To celebrate the start of flights from Tennessee next week, we have 
round-trip fares on sale to Iceland from $479 round-trip, including all taxes!
 Travel is valid this spring from April 15 - June 12. These fares are limited and won't last long, so 
book soon!
Want notices on upcoming sales to Iceland and Europe?
 Have your friends and family 
sign up for our newsletter
 today, and don't forget to 
pick Nashville as your preferred gateway
 for special offers exclusive to Music City!
 
Book soon
 
The real unreal
A place that exists beyond your wildest AI prompts
As the line between what’s real and what’s fake becomes increasingly blurred, we want you to enjoy 
real photos of Iceland
 and celebrate authentic travel experiences. Iceland is a place where you can have a 
real unreal
 experience. 
So we’re delivering a message to the tech giants ...
 
Get real
 
Iceland Fly & Drive Vacation Package
From $689 per person, includes unlimited mileage
With the independence provided with this lcelandair holiday, the how, when and where of exploring Iceland is completely up to you, behind the wheel, with nothing but open roads ahead. 
There’s no better way to explore at your own pace than with a car rental.
 
Grab the wheel
 
Iceland Flight & Motorhome Vacation
From $1,566 per person, includes unlimited mileage
Experience Iceland for yourself on 
a self-driving holiday in your own motorhome - the perfect way to experience the county’s natural phenomena and incredible sights at your own pace.
 With snow-capped glaciers, volcanoes and stunning vistas spread across a landscape, it is not hard to see why Iceland is such a popular destination.
 
Book soon
 
Book your hotel and earn Saga Points
For stays anytime - just book in April!
Earn double Saga Points - 
four Points for each dollar spent
 - on every booking made in April through Icelandair´s hotel search powered by Booking.com. Book in April, stay whenever you want and make sure to add your Saga Club number into the booking. It's that easy!
 
Book in April
 
Rental car discount
Just enter the promocode at checkout for your discount
Receive a 10% discount when booking a car in April, for rentals any time in the year, through Icelandair´s rental car search powered by Rentalcars.com. Add the promo code 
Ice10promoM
 at the time of booking!
 
Book discount
 
Book a tour. Earn double Saga Points.
The possibilities are endless with GetYourGuide!
During the month of April, Saga Club members earn double Saga Points
 when booking their next tour through Icelandair´s activities search, powered by GetYourGuide.com. Just add your Saga Club number in the booking to earn four (4) Saga Points for every Euro spent.

subject: Specialty Plays: Virtual Workshop - Registration OPEN!
body:
View in browser
SHOP SWAG
ONLINE PROGRAMS
CAMPS & EVENTS
When the pressure is on & a perfect play at the plate is needed, will your catcher be ready?
REGISTER FOR THE VIRTUAL WORKSHOP
 
Is your catcher prepared for those rare but game-changing specialty plays?
Although they don't happen often, 
specialty plays can be the difference between winning and losing crucial games
.
Transform Your Catcher's Game in Just Two Days
Join me for a virtual workshop designed specifically to master the techniques, strategies, and safety protocols for executing specialty plays that can save innings and win games.
This clinic will help parents, coaches and catchers:
Who want to 
elevate performance
 in crucial game moments
Who need 
tools & knowledge
 to excel in specialized, high-impact plays
Who want to help their catchers perform 
confidently & safely
 in high-pressure situations
What You'll Learn:
✅ 
Effective techniques
 for executing high-pressure specialty plays
✅ How to build 
confidence and comfort
 with crucial game-changing moments
✅ 
Safety protocols
 for dangerous plays at the plate
✅ Foolproof strategies to 
catch every catchable pop-up
The Details ⬇️
April 26th & 27th (Saturday & Sunday)
5:00pm-7:30pm PST each day
Cost: $20
Are you ready to transform your game?
YES! COUNT ME IN!
 
▶️  This 2-day workshop will take place via Zoom and an email will be sent out with the replay link after the workshop concludes for the day.
🎯  If you can't make it live, don't worry... you can access the replays for free for 24 hours, or we have an option for you to access the recordings for 90 days after the workshop! Just grab the VIP option after you register for the workshop, and you'll be all set.
I'll do lectures, give demonstrations and answer any questions you have.
Have questions? Hit reply and I'll get back to you as soon as possible.
I hope to see you there!
Todd Coburn
The Catching Guy
thecatchingguy.com
Gamer Baseball LLC, PO Box 18083, Reno, NV 89511, United States
Unsubscribe

Hi Monica,
You may have seen a recent message from Sylvia Strobel, our President and CEO, 
about the threats to public media funding
. I’m writing to invite you to take the next step and 
join
 the TPT community.
We’re not chasing a quick fix. We’re working to build a stable foundation—and that starts with new supporters who step up when it matters most.
That’s why we’re asking new supporters to 
join
 as monthly sustainers—and right now, your first gifts will be 
matched dollar-for-dollar
 up to $5,000 through our TPT Member Challenge.
 
Match my Monthly Gift
 
Prefer to start with a one-time gift? That will also be matched
 and deeply appreciated.
This is a perfect moment to take action and make your support go further.
 
 
 
All the best,
David Preston
Vice President of Membership
Twin Cities PBS
 
 
P.S.
 Thanks to our $5,000 Member Challenge, your first gift will be matched—doubling the impact of the first $5,000 we raise from new donors who 
step up to support TPT
.
 
 
 
 
Watch
 
 
Schedule
 
 
Donate
 
 
Subscribe
 
Twin Cities Public Television 
172 East Fourth Street, Saint Paul, MN 55101
 
 
Unsubscribe from TPT fundraising emails
Manage my Email Subscription Preferences

subject: Re: DCP JV Baseball Parent/Guardian Emails (Corrected)
body:
Hello all,
I hope you're doing well! I'm reaching out to let you know that our game today against Riverside-Brookfield at Horner Park has been canceled due to weather. We will NOT be practicing today, so the boys have the day off! We are hoping to get this game rescheduled for this Friday (location to be determined). When this is finalized, I will circle back to let you all know. Tomorrow's game is also questionable based on the amount of rain we've gotten/will get throughout the day today, so I will let you and the boys know about that tomorrow when we know more. Thank you for your flexibility and understanding!
Best,
Coach Hinkamp
On Tue, Apr 1, 2025 at 1:25 PM Zachary Hinkamp <
zhinkamp@depaulprep.org
> wrote:
My apologies for the typo in my previous email. Wednesday's game against Riverside Brookfield is also at home (Hoerner Park) at 4:30pm.
On Tue, Apr 1, 2025 at 11:03 AM Zachary Hinkamp <
zhinkamp@depaulprep.org
> wrote:
Hello all,
I'm reaching out to let you know that there is a slight change for our game at Deerfield High School this afternoon at 4:30pm. We will now be playing on their Lower Level field, located behind their Varsity field. Their Varsity field is still underwater, but the Lower Level field is playable! The Frosh/Soph game against Deerfield has been moved to another location so we can play there. Also, the bus will be leaving from DCP at 3:00pm today. My apologies for not relaying this information earlier.
Looking ahead to the remaining games on our schedule this week:
Tomorrow's game at Riverside Brookfield isn't looking great, as the weather is supposed to get a bit rough with a lot of rain. I will communicate to you and the boys when I get information about this. 
For Thursday, we play at home against Amundsen, but based on the amount of rain we get tomorrow, Hoerner might be unplayable so I will let you all know about that when I hear. 
Friday the boys will have the day off of practice. 
Finally, Saturday we have a 10:00am game at Niles North. There will not be a bus to take us to this game, so we ask that you/the boys get themselves to the field (I will let them know when to get there when we get closer to that day). Niles North is a turf field, so even with the projected rain in the forecast, I'm hoping we can still get this game in! 
Again, I will make sure to communicate with you and the boys when I get word on these games.
Best,
Coach Hinkamp
Best,
Coach Hinkamp
On Sun, Mar 30, 2025 at 2:36 PM Zachary Hinkamp <
zhinkamp@depaulprep.org
> wrote:
Hello all,
I hope you’ve had a great weekend! I’m reaching out to share this week’s game/practice schedule. It is as follows:
-Monday 3/31: Game vs Glenbrook North 4:45pm at Hoerner Park
-Tuesday 4/1: Game at Deerfield High School 4:30pm
-Wednesday 4/2: Game vs Riverside Brookfield 4:30pm at Hoerner Park
-Thursday 4/3: Game vs Amundsen 4:30pm at Hoerner Park
-Friday 4/4: Off
-Saturday 4/5: Game at Niles North High School (turf) 10:00am
I will let the boys know about bus departure times this week. Looking forward to another great week!
GO RAMS!
Coach Hinkamp
Zachary Hinkamp (He/Him), LPC
Counselor
Head Sophomore Football Coach
Assistant JV Baseball Coach

(
2967 S Michigan Ave, Chicago, IL 60616). The bus will be leaving DCP at 3:30pm. 
Best,

On Sun, Mar 23, 2025 at 12:47 PM Zachary Hinkamp <
zhinkamp@depaulprep.org
> wrote:
Hello all,
I hope you've all thawed out after yesterday's double header! Thank you to those that were able to come out and support us in the cold! I thought it was a great start to the season! 
This week is busy with games Monday-Thursday and then again on Saturday. This week's game/practice schedule is as follows:
-Monday 3/24: Game 6:30pm vs St. Pat's @ Reed-Dunning (Bus leaves DCP at 4:00pm)
-Tuesday 3/25: Game 4:30pm @ Whitney Young (Bus leaves DCP at 3:00pm)
-Wednesday 3/26: Game 4:30pm @ Niles West (Bus leaves DCP at 3:00pm)
-Thursday 3/27: Game 5:00pm @ U-High (Bus departure time TBD, will let boys know ASAP)
-Friday 3/28: Practice 3:00pm - 5:00pm @ Kerry Wood Field (might have to shift time and location)
-Saturday 3/29: Game 12:00pm @ Schaumburg (Bud departure time TBD, will let boys know ASAP)
I will follow up with another email when I hear back from Coach Colon regarding Thursday's bus departure, Friday's practice time and location, and Saturday's bus departure. 
GO RAMS!
Coach Hinkamp
On Thu, Mar 13, 2025 at 7:03 AM Zachary Hinkamp <
zhinkamp@depaulprep.org
> wrote:
Hello all,
It was very nice meeting many of you last night! As promised, here is the updated email chain (hoping I've got it correct this time!). As a reminder, I will share the practice schedule for the rest of the week, as well as the week of Spring Break:
Thursday 3/13: No Practice (hoping the boys go to the basketball game)
Friday 3/14: Practice 5:30pm - 7:00pm @ Clark Park
Saturday 3/15: Practice 8:00am - 10:00am @ Kerry Wood Field
SPRING BREAK
Monday 3/17: No Practice
Tuesday 3/18: No Practice
Wednesday 3/19: No Practice
Thursday 3/20: Practice (Time/Location TBD - will communicate when confirmed)
Friday 3/21: Practice (Time/Location TBD - will communicate when confirmed)
Saturday 3/22: Games 10:00am / 12:00pm (Double Header) vs Taft @ Laramie Park (Skokie)
I will be sending another email today or tomorrow (whenever I'm able to get this information confirmed) regarding the practice times and locations for Thursday and Friday of Spring Break. 
Again, thank you all for everything you've done/will do for the boys and team this year! 
GO RAMS!
Coach Hinkamp
--
